questions: Q. 1. Name the largest artery in the human body.
answers: Ans. The largest artery in the human body is Aorta.

questions: Q. 2. Why is the walls of ventricles thicker than the walls of atria ?
answers: Ans. Ventricles have to pump blood into various organs. So, they have thicker walls than the walls of atria. 1

questions: Q. 3. Name the tissues which (i) transport soluble products of photosynthesis in plants, (ii) transport water and minerals in a plant.
Q. 4. What process in plants is known as transpiration ?
answers: Ans. It is the loss of water in the vapour form from the exposed parts of a plant.

questions: Q. 5. What is transported by lymph ?
answers: Ans. Lymph carries digested and absorbed fat from intestine.

questions: Q. 6. Name the component of blood which transport : (i) Food, carbon dioxide and nitrogenous wastes (ii) Oxygen.
answers: Ans. (i) Plasma (ii) Haemoglobin present in RBCs.

questions: Q. 7. Name the process of loss of water in the form of vapour from the aerial parts of the plants.
